trans-unit.source: Create an AS2 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services
trans-unit.target: Create an AS2 Agreement in Azure BizTalk Services

trans-unit.source: Create an AS2 agreement in <token>af_integration</token> to exchange messages between trading partners using the AS2 protocol.
trans-unit.target: Create an AS2 agreement in <token>af_integration</token> to exchange messages between trading partners using the AS2 protocol.

trans-unit.source: AS2 non-EDI messaging
trans-unit.target: AS2 non-EDI messaging

trans-unit.source: AS2 messages can be sent to a non-EDI destination or received from a non-EDI destination.
trans-unit.target: AS2 messages can be sent to a non-EDI destination or received from a non-EDI destination.

trans-unit.source: This functionality is built into AS2 so you don’t have to worry about the transport protocol.
trans-unit.target: This functionality is built into AS2 so you don’t have to worry about the transport protocol.

trans-unit.source: You can use X12, EDIFACT, or other protocols that are not included with <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: You can use X12, EDIFACT, or other protocols that are not included with <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: For example, you receive a non-EDI message from a supplier over AS2.
trans-unit.target: For example, you receive a non-EDI message from a supplier over AS2.

trans-unit.source: You process the XML data and then transform the message to UBL documents.
trans-unit.target: You process the XML data and then transform the message to UBL documents.

trans-unit.source: Non-EDI messaging is enabled in the <token>msgflow_proj</token> or in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.
trans-unit.target: Non-EDI messaging is enabled in the <token>msgflow_proj</token> or in the <token>tpm_portal</token>.

trans-unit.source: To use non-EDI messaging in the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, use any of the following tools in the Toolbox:
trans-unit.target: To use non-EDI messaging in the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, use any of the following tools in the Toolbox:

trans-unit.source: Two-Way External Service Endpoint
trans-unit.target: Two-Way External Service Endpoint

trans-unit.source: Two-Way Relay Endpoint
trans-unit.target: Two-Way Relay Endpoint

trans-unit.source: AS2 Non-Repudiation of Receipt (NRR)
trans-unit.target: AS2 Non-Repudiation of Receipt (NRR)

trans-unit.source: AS2 includes Non-Repudiation of Receipt (NRR) support.
trans-unit.target: AS2 includes Non-Repudiation of Receipt (NRR) support.

trans-unit.source: Non-Repudiation provides proof that a message is valid and authentic.
trans-unit.target: Non-Repudiation provides proof that a message is valid and authentic.

trans-unit.source: If the message validity is ever questioned, its validity can be proven and possibly legally binding.
trans-unit.target: If the message validity is ever questioned, its validity can be proven and possibly legally binding.

trans-unit.source: For example, you and Contoso agree to non-repudiation.
trans-unit.target: For example, you and Contoso agree to non-repudiation.

trans-unit.source: You send an AS2 message to Contoso to purchase <legacyItalic>widgets</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: You send an AS2 message to Contoso to purchase <legacyItalic>widgets</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Then, you deny sending the message to purchase the widgets from Contoso.
trans-unit.target: Then, you deny sending the message to purchase the widgets from Contoso.

trans-unit.source: With non-repudiation enabled, Contoso can retrieve the message to confirm that you agreed to purchase the widgets.
trans-unit.target: With non-repudiation enabled, Contoso can retrieve the message to confirm that you agreed to purchase the widgets.

trans-unit.source: Non-Repudiation of Receipt (NRR) is enabled in the <token>tpm_portal</token> and is used for EDI and non-EDI messages.
trans-unit.target: Non-Repudiation of Receipt (NRR) is enabled in the <token>tpm_portal</token> and is used for EDI and non-EDI messages.

trans-unit.source: The topics in this section list the steps to create an AS2 agreement, including Non-Repudiation and non-EDI destinations.
trans-unit.target: The topics in this section list the steps to create an AS2 agreement, including Non-Repudiation and non-EDI destinations.

trans-unit.source: Configure the AS2 General Settings
trans-unit.target: Configure the AS2 General Settings

trans-unit.source: The first step to create an AS2 agreement between two trading partners is to enter the partners and their AS2 identities.
trans-unit.target: The first step to create an AS2 agreement between two trading partners is to enter the partners and their AS2 identities.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, select <ui>Agreements</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> home page, select <ui>Agreements</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the Agreements page, select the <ui>AS2</ui> tab.
trans-unit.target: On the Agreements page, select the <ui>AS2</ui> tab.

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>General Settings</ui> tab is displayed.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>General Settings</ui> tab is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following properties:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following properties:

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Enter a unique name for the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Enter a unique name for the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Enter notes or a description for the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Enter notes or a description for the agreement.

trans-unit.source: For hosted and guest partners, enter the following:
trans-unit.target: For hosted and guest partners, enter the following:

trans-unit.source: Hosted Partner
trans-unit.target: Hosted Partner

trans-unit.source: Partner
trans-unit.target: Partner

trans-unit.source: Select the hosted partner for the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Select the hosted partner for the agreement.

trans-unit.source: A hosted partner is the partner that <token>af_integration</token> deploys the AS2 send and receive pipelines.
trans-unit.target: A hosted partner is the partner that <token>af_integration</token> deploys the AS2 send and receive pipelines.

trans-unit.source: Profile
trans-unit.target: Profile

trans-unit.source: The default profile is displayed.
trans-unit.target: The default profile is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Choose the desired profile which has been configured for the partner.
trans-unit.target: Choose the desired profile which has been configured for the partner.

trans-unit.source: AS2 Identity
trans-unit.target: AS2 Identity

trans-unit.source: Enter the AS2 Identity, which is the name to identify the partner.
trans-unit.target: Enter the AS2 Identity, which is the name to identify the partner.

trans-unit.source: Examples include the company name or the company department.
trans-unit.target: Examples include the company name or the company department.

trans-unit.source: Guest Partner
trans-unit.target: Guest Partner

trans-unit.source: Partner
trans-unit.target: Partner

trans-unit.source: Select the partner for the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Select the partner for the agreement.

trans-unit.source: A Guest Partner is a partner managed by the service provider and the pipelines are deployed for that partner during agreement deployment.
trans-unit.target: A Guest Partner is a partner managed by the service provider and the pipelines are deployed for that partner during agreement deployment.

trans-unit.source: Profile
trans-unit.target: Profile

trans-unit.source: The default profile is displayed.
trans-unit.target: The default profile is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Choose the desired profile which has been configured for the partner.
trans-unit.target: Choose the desired profile which has been configured for the partner.

trans-unit.source: AS2 Identity
trans-unit.target: AS2 Identity

trans-unit.source: Enter the AS2 Identity, which is the name to identify the partner.
trans-unit.target: Enter the AS2 Identity, which is the name to identify the partner.

trans-unit.source: Examples include the company name or the company department.
trans-unit.target: Examples include the company name or the company department.

trans-unit.source: Under NRR Status, select the <embeddedLabel>Enable NRR</embeddedLabel> checkbox to enable non-repudiation on receipt (NRR) in the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Under NRR Status, select the <embeddedLabel>Enable NRR</embeddedLabel> checkbox to enable non-repudiation on receipt (NRR) in the agreement.

trans-unit.source: NRR is used when the Hosted Partner and Guest Partner agree to use NRR.
trans-unit.target: NRR is used when the Hosted Partner and Guest Partner agree to use NRR.

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Continue</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Continue</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The Receive Settings and Send Settings tabs are added.
trans-unit.target: The Receive Settings and Send Settings tabs are added.

trans-unit.source: Each tab is used to create a one-way agreement between the two partners: one to receive messages and another for sending messages.
trans-unit.target: Each tab is used to create a one-way agreement between the two partners: one to receive messages and another for sending messages.

trans-unit.source: Configure the AS2 Receive Settings
trans-unit.target: Configure the AS2 Receive Settings

trans-unit.source: AS2 receive settings primarily include protocol details such as message signing, encryption, and compression, as well as sending MDNs.
trans-unit.target: AS2 receive settings primarily include protocol details such as message signing, encryption, and compression, as well as sending MDNs.

trans-unit.source: Select the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab of the AS2 agreement page.
trans-unit.target: Select the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab of the AS2 agreement page.

trans-unit.source: The first step is to determine whether the receive settings in the agreement are used <legacyUnderline>or</legacyUnderline> the settings in the incoming messages are used.
trans-unit.target: The first step is to determine whether the receive settings in the agreement are used <legacyUnderline>or</legacyUnderline> the settings in the incoming messages are used.

trans-unit.source: Whether you check or uncheck the <ui>Override receive side agreement settings with those in the incoming AS2 message</ui> governs that.
trans-unit.target: Whether you check or uncheck the <ui>Override receive side agreement settings with those in the incoming AS2 message</ui> governs that.

trans-unit.source: Cleared
trans-unit.target: Cleared

trans-unit.source: Use the settings configured in the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Use the settings configured in the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Checked
trans-unit.target: Checked

trans-unit.source: Use the settings from the incoming messages and override the settings in the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Use the settings from the incoming messages and override the settings in the agreement.

trans-unit.source: The following settings are always honored in the agreement and never overridden:
trans-unit.target: The following settings are always honored in the agreement and never overridden:

trans-unit.source: MDN Text
trans-unit.target: MDN Text

trans-unit.source: Message should be encrypted
trans-unit.target: Message should be encrypted

trans-unit.source: Message should be signed
trans-unit.target: Message should be signed

trans-unit.source: Choose the message settings to use with this agreement or template:
trans-unit.target: Choose the message settings to use with this agreement or template:

trans-unit.source: Message should be signed
trans-unit.target: Message should be signed

trans-unit.source: This option forces the Guest Partner to sign the AS2 messages with their private certificate before sending the message to the Hosted Partner.
trans-unit.target: This option forces the Guest Partner to sign the AS2 messages with their private certificate before sending the message to the Hosted Partner.

trans-unit.source: The Guest Partner has a Private Certificate (.pfx).
trans-unit.target: The Guest Partner has a Private Certificate (.pfx).

trans-unit.source: The Guest Partner creates the corresponding public certificate (.cer) and sends it to you, the Service Provider.
trans-unit.target: The Guest Partner creates the corresponding public certificate (.cer) and sends it to you, the Service Provider.

trans-unit.source: This corresponding public key certificate (.cer) is uploaded by you to the Guest Partner’s profile.
trans-unit.target: This corresponding public key certificate (.cer) is uploaded by you to the Guest Partner’s profile.

trans-unit.source: This public key certificate validates the signature of the Guest Partner.
trans-unit.target: This public key certificate validates the signature of the Guest Partner.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Certificate</ui>: In the drop down list, choose the Guest Partner’s public certificate (.cer) you uploaded to the Guest Partner’s profile.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Certificate</ui>: In the drop down list, choose the Guest Partner’s public certificate (.cer) you uploaded to the Guest Partner’s profile.

trans-unit.source: Incoming messages are checked for the correct signature of the Guest Partner.
trans-unit.target: Incoming messages are checked for the correct signature of the Guest Partner.

trans-unit.source: This option cannot be overridden by an incoming message.
trans-unit.target: This option cannot be overridden by an incoming message.

trans-unit.source: Message should be encrypted
trans-unit.target: Message should be encrypted

trans-unit.source: This option forces the Guest Partner to encrypt the message being received by the Hosted Partner.
trans-unit.target: This option forces the Guest Partner to encrypt the message being received by the Hosted Partner.

trans-unit.source: The Hosted Partner has a Private Certificate (.pfx) uploaded to its profile.
trans-unit.target: The Hosted Partner has a Private Certificate (.pfx) uploaded to its profile.

trans-unit.source: You create the corresponding public certificate (.cer) and send the public certificate to the Guest Partner.
trans-unit.target: You create the corresponding public certificate (.cer) and send the public certificate to the Guest Partner.

trans-unit.source: The Guest Partner’s public certificate encrypts the message and the Hosted Partner’s corresponding private certificate decrypts the message.
trans-unit.target: The Guest Partner’s public certificate encrypts the message and the Hosted Partner’s corresponding private certificate decrypts the message.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Certificate</ui>: In the drop down list, choose the Hosted Partner’s private certificate (.pfx) you added to the Hosted Partner’s profile.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Certificate</ui>: In the drop down list, choose the Hosted Partner’s private certificate (.pfx) you added to the Hosted Partner’s profile.

trans-unit.source: Incoming encrypted messages are decrypted using the private key certificate from the Hosted Partner’s profile.
trans-unit.target: Incoming encrypted messages are decrypted using the private key certificate from the Hosted Partner’s profile.

trans-unit.source: This option cannot be overridden by an incoming message.
trans-unit.target: This option cannot be overridden by an incoming message.

trans-unit.source: Message should be compressed
trans-unit.target: Message should be compressed

trans-unit.source: Choose this option to compress messages sent from the Guest Partner to the Hosted Partner.
trans-unit.target: Choose this option to compress messages sent from the Guest Partner to the Hosted Partner.

trans-unit.source: Choose the acknowledgement settings you want to use with this agreement or template.
trans-unit.target: Choose the acknowledgement settings you want to use with this agreement or template.

trans-unit.source: These settings specify that the Guest Partner requests an acknowledgment message from the Hosted Partner in the agreement.
trans-unit.target: These settings specify that the Guest Partner requests an acknowledgment message from the Hosted Partner in the agreement.

trans-unit.source: The acknowledgment messages from the Hosted Partner are sent to the Guest Partner based on the <ui>URL</ui> in the Send Settings of this AS2 agreement.
trans-unit.target: The acknowledgment messages from the Hosted Partner are sent to the Guest Partner based on the <ui>URL</ui> in the Send Settings of this AS2 agreement.

trans-unit.source: MDN Text
trans-unit.target: MDN Text

trans-unit.source: Enter the text used in the body of the Message Disposition Notification (MDN) receipt.
trans-unit.target: Enter the text used in the body of the Message Disposition Notification (MDN) receipt.

trans-unit.source: This applies if the message sender requests the MDN or the agreement is configured to send MDN receipts.
trans-unit.target: This applies if the message sender requests the MDN or the agreement is configured to send MDN receipts.

trans-unit.source: Send MDN
trans-unit.target: Send MDN

trans-unit.source: This setting configures the agreement to send MDN receipts to the sender, which is the Guest Partner.
trans-unit.target: This setting configures the agreement to send MDN receipts to the sender, which is the Guest Partner.

trans-unit.source: The sender in the context of the receive settings of the agreement is the Guest Partner.
trans-unit.target: The sender in the context of the receive settings of the agreement is the Guest Partner.

trans-unit.source: The following options are available when sending the MDN to the Guest Partner:
trans-unit.target: The following options are available when sending the MDN to the Guest Partner:

trans-unit.source: Send Signed MDN
trans-unit.target: Send Signed MDN

trans-unit.source: This option configures whether the MDN receipt is sent to the Guest Partner and is signed by the Hosted Partner’s private key certificate.
trans-unit.target: This option configures whether the MDN receipt is sent to the Guest Partner and is signed by the Hosted Partner’s private key certificate.

trans-unit.source: You can optionally choose a <ui>MIC algorithm</ui> option.
trans-unit.target: You can optionally choose a <ui>MIC algorithm</ui> option.

trans-unit.source: The following <ui>MIC algorithm</ui> options are supported for computing the Received-Content-MIC field of the outgoing MDN for non-repudiation at the Guest Partner:
trans-unit.target: The following <ui>MIC algorithm</ui> options are supported for computing the Received-Content-MIC field of the outgoing MDN for non-repudiation at the Guest Partner:

trans-unit.source: <ui>MD5</ui> : Received-Content-MIC field populated using the MD5 algorithm.
trans-unit.target: <ui>MD5</ui> : Received-Content-MIC field populated using the MD5 algorithm.

trans-unit.source: <ui>SHA1</ui> (Default) : Received-Content-MIC field populated using the SHA1 algorithm.
trans-unit.target: <ui>SHA1</ui> (Default) : Received-Content-MIC field populated using the SHA1 algorithm.

trans-unit.source: <ui>SHA2-256</ui> : Received-Content-MIC field populated using the SHA2-256 algorithm.
trans-unit.target: <ui>SHA2-256</ui> : Received-Content-MIC field populated using the SHA2-256 algorithm.

trans-unit.source: <ui>SHA2-384</ui> : Received-Content-MIC field populated using the SHA2-384 algorithm.
trans-unit.target: <ui>SHA2-384</ui> : Received-Content-MIC field populated using the SHA2-384 algorithm.

trans-unit.source: <ui>SHA2-512</ui> : Received-Content-MIC field populated using the SHA2-512 algorithm.
trans-unit.target: <ui>SHA2-512</ui> : Received-Content-MIC field populated using the SHA2-512 algorithm.

trans-unit.source: For security reasons, it is recommended to use a SHA algorithm instead of MD5.
trans-unit.target: For security reasons, it is recommended to use a SHA algorithm instead of MD5.

trans-unit.source: Send asynchronous MDN
trans-unit.target: Send asynchronous MDN

trans-unit.source: Choose this option to send an asynchronous MDN receipt to the Guest Partner.
trans-unit.target: Choose this option to send an asynchronous MDN receipt to the Guest Partner.

trans-unit.source: Enter the endpoint <ui>URL</ui> that the Guest Partner receives MDNs.
trans-unit.target: Enter the endpoint <ui>URL</ui> that the Guest Partner receives MDNs.

trans-unit.source: For information on importing certificates on the computer, see <link xlink:href="c3b8d534-fc79-4203-8f09-cd3ac3510675" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Importing certificates</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information on importing certificates on the computer, see <link xlink:href="c3b8d534-fc79-4203-8f09-cd3ac3510675" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Importing certificates</link>.

trans-unit.source: Configure the AS2 Send Settings
trans-unit.target: Configure the AS2 Send Settings

trans-unit.source: AS2 send settings primarily include protocol details such as message signing, encryption, and compression, as well as requesting an MDN.
trans-unit.target: AS2 send settings primarily include protocol details such as message signing, encryption, and compression, as well as requesting an MDN.

trans-unit.source: Select the <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tab of the AS2 agreement page.
trans-unit.target: Select the <embeddedLabel>Send Settings</embeddedLabel> tab of the AS2 agreement page.

trans-unit.source: Choose the message settings to use with this agreement.
trans-unit.target: Choose the message settings to use with this agreement.

trans-unit.source: These settings are used when sending AS2 messages from the hosted partner to the guest partner:
trans-unit.target: These settings are used when sending AS2 messages from the hosted partner to the guest partner:

trans-unit.source: Enable message signing
trans-unit.target: Enable message signing

trans-unit.source: This option signs messages sent from the hosted partner to the guest partner.
trans-unit.target: This option signs messages sent from the hosted partner to the guest partner.

trans-unit.source: The Hosted Partner has a Private Certificate (.pfx) used for signing uploaded to the Hosted Partner’s profile.
trans-unit.target: The Hosted Partner has a Private Certificate (.pfx) used for signing uploaded to the Hosted Partner’s profile.

trans-unit.source: You create the corresponding public certificate (.cer) and send the public certificate to the Guest Partner.
trans-unit.target: You create the corresponding public certificate (.cer) and send the public certificate to the Guest Partner.

trans-unit.source: This public key validates the Hosted Partner’s signature to the Guest Partner.
trans-unit.target: This public key validates the Hosted Partner’s signature to the Guest Partner.

trans-unit.source: <ui>MIC algorithm</ui> options:
trans-unit.target: <ui>MIC algorithm</ui> options:

trans-unit.source: MD5
trans-unit.target: MD5

trans-unit.source: <ui>SHA1</ui> (default)
trans-unit.target: <ui>SHA1</ui> (default)

trans-unit.source: <ui>SHA2-256</ui>
trans-unit.target: <ui>SHA2-256</ui>

trans-unit.source: <ui>SHA2-384</ui>
trans-unit.target: <ui>SHA2-384</ui>

trans-unit.source: <ui>SHA2-512</ui>
trans-unit.target: <ui>SHA2-512</ui>

trans-unit.source: For security reasons, it is recommended to use a SHA algorithm instead of MD5.
trans-unit.target: For security reasons, it is recommended to use a SHA algorithm instead of MD5.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Certificate</ui>: In the drop down list, choose the Hosted Partner’s private certificate (.pfx) you added to the Hosted Partner’s profile.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Certificate</ui>: In the drop down list, choose the Hosted Partner’s private certificate (.pfx) you added to the Hosted Partner’s profile.

trans-unit.source: Outgoing messages sent to the Guest Partner are signed with the Hosted Partner’s signing certificate.
trans-unit.target: Outgoing messages sent to the Guest Partner are signed with the Hosted Partner’s signing certificate.

trans-unit.source: Enable message encryption
trans-unit.target: Enable message encryption

trans-unit.source: This option is used by the Hosted Partner to encrypt AS2 messages using the Guest Partner’s public certificate (.cer).
trans-unit.target: This option is used by the Hosted Partner to encrypt AS2 messages using the Guest Partner’s public certificate (.cer).

trans-unit.source: Your Guest Partner has a Private Certificate (.pfx).
trans-unit.target: Your Guest Partner has a Private Certificate (.pfx).

trans-unit.source: The Guest Partner creates the corresponding public certificate (.cer) and sends it to you, the Service Provider.
trans-unit.target: The Guest Partner creates the corresponding public certificate (.cer) and sends it to you, the Service Provider.

trans-unit.source: This corresponding public key certificate (.cer) is uploaded by you to the Guest Partner’s profile.
trans-unit.target: This corresponding public key certificate (.cer) is uploaded by you to the Guest Partner’s profile.

trans-unit.source: Your Hosted Partner’s public certificate encrypts the message and your Guest Partner’s corresponding private certificate decrypts the message.
trans-unit.target: Your Hosted Partner’s public certificate encrypts the message and your Guest Partner’s corresponding private certificate decrypts the message.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Encryption algorithm</ui> options:
trans-unit.target: <ui>Encryption algorithm</ui> options:

trans-unit.source: AES-128
trans-unit.target: AES-128

trans-unit.source: AES-192
trans-unit.target: AES-192

trans-unit.source: AES-256
trans-unit.target: AES-256

trans-unit.source: <ui>DES3</ui> (default)
trans-unit.target: <ui>DES3</ui> (default)

trans-unit.source: RC2
trans-unit.target: RC2

trans-unit.source: For security reasons, it is recommended to use an AES or DES algorithm instead of RC2.
trans-unit.target: For security reasons, it is recommended to use an AES or DES algorithm instead of RC2.

trans-unit.source: <ui>Certificate</ui>: In the drop down list, choose the Guest Partner’s public certificate (.cer) you added to the Guest Partner’s profile.
trans-unit.target: <ui>Certificate</ui>: In the drop down list, choose the Guest Partner’s public certificate (.cer) you added to the Guest Partner’s profile.

trans-unit.source: Outgoing messages are encrypted using the public key certificate from the Guest Partner’s profile.
trans-unit.target: Outgoing messages are encrypted using the public key certificate from the Guest Partner’s profile.

trans-unit.source: Enable message compression
trans-unit.target: Enable message compression

trans-unit.source: Choose this option to compress messages sent from the Hosted Partner to the Guest Partner.
trans-unit.target: Choose this option to compress messages sent from the Hosted Partner to the Guest Partner.

trans-unit.source: Unfold HTTP headers
trans-unit.target: Unfold HTTP headers

trans-unit.source: Select this check box to unfold HTTP content-type headers into a single line.
trans-unit.target: Select this check box to unfold HTTP content-type headers into a single line.

trans-unit.source: For information on importing certificates on the computer, see <link xlink:href="c3b8d534-fc79-4203-8f09-cd3ac3510675" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Importing certificates</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information on importing certificates on the computer, see <link xlink:href="c3b8d534-fc79-4203-8f09-cd3ac3510675" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Importing certificates</link>.

trans-unit.source: Choose the acknowledge settings you want to use with this agreement or template.
trans-unit.target: Choose the acknowledge settings you want to use with this agreement or template.

trans-unit.source: These settings specify that the Hosted Partner requests an acknowledgment message from the Guest Partner in the agreement.
trans-unit.target: These settings specify that the Hosted Partner requests an acknowledgment message from the Guest Partner in the agreement.

trans-unit.source: The acknowledgment messages from the Guest Partner are sent to the Hosted Partner based on the <ui>Inbound URI URL</ui> in the Receive Settings of the agreement.
trans-unit.target: The acknowledgment messages from the Guest Partner are sent to the Hosted Partner based on the <ui>Inbound URI URL</ui> in the Receive Settings of the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Request MDN
trans-unit.target: Request MDN

trans-unit.source: This setting configures the agreement to send MDN receipts to the sender of the original AS2 message, which is the Hosted Partner.
trans-unit.target: This setting configures the agreement to send MDN receipts to the sender of the original AS2 message, which is the Hosted Partner.

trans-unit.source: Acknowledgements are sent to the Hosted Partner after successful delivery of the AS2 message.
trans-unit.target: Acknowledgements are sent to the Hosted Partner after successful delivery of the AS2 message.

trans-unit.source: The following options are available when the Hosted Partner requests a MDN:
trans-unit.target: The following options are available when the Hosted Partner requests a MDN:

trans-unit.source: Request signed MDN
trans-unit.target: Request signed MDN

trans-unit.source: This option requests that the MDN receipt is signed with the Guest Partner’s private key.
trans-unit.target: This option requests that the MDN receipt is signed with the Guest Partner’s private key.

trans-unit.source: The signature is validated using the Guest Partner’s public key certificate that is uploaded to the Guest Partner’s profile.
trans-unit.target: The signature is validated using the Guest Partner’s public key certificate that is uploaded to the Guest Partner’s profile.

trans-unit.source: Request asynchronous MDN
trans-unit.target: Request asynchronous MDN

trans-unit.source: This option requests that the MDN receipts are sent asynchronously to the sender of the original AS2 message, which is the Hosted Partner.
trans-unit.target: This option requests that the MDN receipts are sent asynchronously to the sender of the original AS2 message, which is the Hosted Partner.

trans-unit.source: The asynchronous message is sent to the <ui>Inbound URI URL</ui> for the Hosted Partner.
trans-unit.target: The asynchronous message is sent to the <ui>Inbound URI URL</ui> for the Hosted Partner.

trans-unit.source: This <ui>Inbound URI URL</ui> is set on the Receive Settings of the agreement.
trans-unit.target: This <ui>Inbound URI URL</ui> is set on the Receive Settings of the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to save the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to save the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Known Issues
trans-unit.target: Known Issues

trans-unit.source: The <token>tpm_portal</token> allows you to modify the Qualifier of an Identity when an agreement is configured.
trans-unit.target: The <token>tpm_portal</token> allows you to modify the Qualifier of an Identity when an agreement is configured.

trans-unit.source: This can result in inconsistence properties.
trans-unit.target: This can result in inconsistence properties.

trans-unit.source: For example, there is an agreement using ZZ:1234567 and ZZ:7654321 the Qualifier.
trans-unit.target: For example, there is an agreement using ZZ:1234567 and ZZ:7654321 the Qualifier.

trans-unit.source: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> profile settings, you change ZZ:1234567 to be 01:<legacyItalic>ChangedValue</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>tpm_portal</token> profile settings, you change ZZ:1234567 to be 01:<legacyItalic>ChangedValue</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: You open the agreement and 01:<legacyItalic>ChangedValue</legacyItalic> is displayed instead of ZZ:1234567.
trans-unit.target: You open the agreement and 01:<legacyItalic>ChangedValue</legacyItalic> is displayed instead of ZZ:1234567.

trans-unit.source: To modify the Qualifier of an identity, delete the agreement, update <ui>Identities</ui> in the partner profile, and then recreate the agreement.
trans-unit.target: To modify the Qualifier of an identity, delete the agreement, update <ui>Identities</ui> in the partner profile, and then recreate the agreement.

trans-unit.source: This behavior impacts X12 and AS2.
trans-unit.target: This behavior impacts X12 and AS2.

trans-unit.source: Attachments for AS2 messages are not supported in send or receive.
trans-unit.target: Attachments for AS2 messages are not supported in send or receive.

trans-unit.source: Specifically, attachments are silently ignored and the message body is processed as a regular AS2 message.
trans-unit.target: Specifically, attachments are silently ignored and the message body is processed as a regular AS2 message.
